poem:
"Frames of Illusion"

In the heart of the arena,
a shape deceived.
Confronted: a crude tapestry
weaved of whispered bigotry.
Discords thrown among bright lights
and bouncing giants—
A scandal smooth as the ball
that slides from practiced palms.
Sorrow, not for  the tarnished man,
but the fractured image—ripples
across a court, staining the 
unseen corners of the game.
